intro: Maytenus obovata, commonly known as the ovalleaf mayten, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Phyllantaceae and is characterized by its glossy, obovate leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stems. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by round, fleshy berries that are edible for some bird species. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Maytenus obovata is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
